intro: Dilkea lecta, commonly known as the narrow-leafed daisy, is a herbaceous perennial native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its yellow center surrounded by white petals makes it a striking addition to gardens. Dilkea lecta thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and borders.
